p: Millions of people are currently exposed to a high risk of contamination. Among them, adults taking care of family members who tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 at home, and medical and paramedical staffs treating hospitalized patients with symptomatic COVID-19, are highly susceptible to infection and may represent a second wave of extreme importance in the next few weeks. If those people get sick, we'll face another significant problem. Those highly exposed people should be protected. In that case, social distancing measures do not apply. In the absence of a vaccine, post-exposure pharmacological protection is the only way to prevent caregivers from becoming symptomatic.
